page.title: 01LANDSCAPE DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content: The area lies within the northernmost extent of the chalk uplands of Wiltshire, mostly to the east of the NW-SE valley of the River Og. The scarp, 210740 - 200725, rises from 150 m in the valley to 235m at highest point, 215735.To the east of the scarp, it is typical chalk country with undulating hills and some fairly steep valley sides. The hills area round topped, rising to about 200m, and the dry valleys run mainly NW=SE. There is a gradual decline S>E> towards the Kennet Valley. The lowest point-120m is in Sound Bottom, 240710.The soil is a mixature of thin light soils and clay aith flints, the latter increasing to the east of the area.
